page.title: 18Uppermill 5
page.content: {Whit Friday}is an excitingday for Saddleworth people and is usually taken as a holiday. In the morning the congregation from each church forms a procession led by the local{brass {band}and they walk through the village in a procession of witness to God. Many processions join together for an outdoor service in Uppermill. In the evening each village stages a{brass {band contest}at which bands from throughout northern England compete. The{Rushcart festival}is a revival of an ancient custom in which after the harvest the rushes are taken into church as a thanksgiving and to renew the floorcovering.The event takes place at the end of August with groups of{Morris Men}pulling the cart through the village
